title: Infected Mushroom
comment: Reverting edit(s) by [[Special:Contributions/71.196.253.12|71.196.253.12]] ([[User_talk:71.196.253.12|talk]]) to rev. 1112958842 by 76.202.66.183: likely [[WP:PROVEIT|factual errors]] [[w:en:WP:RW|(RW 16.1)]]
text:
{{short description|Israeli psytrance/electronica duo}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Infected Mushroom | image = Infected Mushroom - Shuni 2015 01 (cropped).JPG | caption = Infected Mushroom performing in [[Binyamina]] in 2015 | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Kiryat Yam]], [[Haifa District]], [[Israel]]{{cite web | title=THEY'RE INFECTIOUS | work=Los Angeles Times | url=http://articles.latimes.com/2008/jan/24/entertainment/gd-nightcandy24mushroom | date=24 January 2008 | access-date=25 May 2008}} | genre = [[Psychedelic trance]], [[electro house]], [[electronica]], [[dream trance]], [[electronic rock]], [[glitch hop]], [[classical music]], [[Industrial music|industrial]], [[experimental music|experimental]], [[progressive psytrance]] | years_active = 1996–present | label = BNE, Hom-Mega, [[Dim Mak Records|Dim Mak]], [[Perfecto Records|Perfecto]], [[Monstercat]] | associated_acts = [[Astrix]], [[Hadag Nahash]], [[Savant (musician)|Savant]], [[Skazi]], [[Paul Oakenfold]], [[Hatikva 6]], [[Jonathan Davis]], [[Datsik (musician)|Datsik]], [[Perry Farrell]], [[Matisyahu]], [[The M Machine]], [[Lady Gaga]], [[Ray Manzarek]], [[Steve Aoki]], [[Pegboard Nerds]], Kelsy, Yahel Sherman, Xerox, Randy Seidman | website = [http://www.infected-mushroom.com infected-mushroom.com] | current_members = Amit Duvdevani
Erez Eisen
Erez Netz
Rogério Jardim
Thomas Cunningham }} '''Infected Mushroom''' is an [[Israelis|Israeli]] musical duo formed in [[Haifa]] in 1996 by producers Erez Eisen and Amit Duvdevani. They produce and perform [[psytrance]], [[electronica]], [[dream trance]] and [[psychedelic music]]. They are one of the best-selling groups in [[Israeli music|Israeli music history]] in terms of both domestic and international sales.''Billboard''8 Mar 2008, Vol. 120, No. 10, Published by Nielsen Business Media, Inc, p. 52. They employ a variety of musical sources, including [[acoustic guitar]]s and complex [[Synthesizer|synthesized]] basses. Their compositions often contain changes of [[drum beat]] and [[tempo]]. Infected Mushroom's live shows feature [[Singing|vocals]] and [[Analog device|analogue]] instruments in performances that are set against a [[multimedia]] backdrop. == Members == [[File:InfectedMushroom02.jpg|thumb|right|330px|Infected Mushroom at the [[DNA Lounge]] in 2002]] Erez Eisen was born on 8 September 1980 in [[Qiryat Yam]], Israel. He began classical musical training at a young age, learning to play the organ at the age of four{{cite web|title=Biography of Infected Mushroom|url=http://www.residentadvisor.net/dj/infectedmushroom/biography|work=Resident Advisor|publisher=Resident Advisor Ltd.|access-date=18 June 2012}} and studying classical piano at the Haifa Conservatory from the age of eight. Eisen became involved with computerized music at age 11, beginning with [[Impulse Tracker]] and later moving to more advanced [[Music sequencer|musical composition software]].{{cite web|url=http://www.emusician.com/artists/1333/geeking-out-with-infected-mushroom/41649 |title=Infected Mushroom Interview | EM Interviews Infected Mushroom Erez Eisen and Amit Duvdev Duvedevani on Recording Legend of the Black Shawarma |publisher=Emusician.com |access-date=28 July 2011}} Eisen had collaborated with DJ Jörg and other notable psytrance artists by the age of 18,{{cite web|author=ShivaS |url=http://www.isratrance.com/interviews/erez-eizen-shidapu-infected-mushroom-i6.html |title=Interview with Erez Eizen (Shidapu / Infected Mushroom) |publisher=Isratrance.com |access-date=28 July 2011}} and has released three [[album]]s and many [[Single (music)|singles]] under other psytrance monikers, including Shidapu and Shiva Shidapu.{{cite web |url=http://www.enchantinggoa.com/Default.aspx?fuseaction=music/artists |title=Goa Psychedelic Trance (Psych Trance) Music Artists |publisher=Enchantinggoa.com |access-date=28 July 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111006181019/http://www.enchantinggoa.com/Default.aspx?fuseaction=music%2Fartists |archive-date=6 October 2011 |url-status=dead }} Amit Duvdevani was born on 7 November 1974 in Israel and has a similar musical background as Eisen. He started to play classical piano at age seven and continued to do so for nine years. He then progressed to [[heavy metal music]] and [[punk rock]]. Duvdevani played keyboards and wrote most of the material for the Haifa punk rock band Enzyme{{Cite journal| year=2001| title=Infected Mushroom Interview – 2001| journal=Implant Magazine| issue=20| url=http://www.doofcentral.com/index.php?option=content&task=view&id=8&Itemid=25| access-date=28 July 2011| url-status=dead| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219120125/http://www.doofcentral.com/index.php?option=content&task=view&id=8&Itemid=25| archive-date=19 February 2014| df=dmy-all}}—he attended his first trance party in 1991.{{cite news|title=INFECTED MUSHROOM|url=http://www.israpost.com/Community/articles/iPhone_Show.php?articleID=17335|access-date=3 May 2014|newspaper=IsraPost}} Duvdevani was conscripted into the [[Israel Defense Forces]], where he was first nicknamed, "Duvdev".{{cite web|title=Infected Mushroom Biography|url=http://thedjlist.com/djs/INFECTED_MUSHROOM/bio/|work=The DJ List|publisher=The DJ List, Inc|access-date=18 June 2012}} After he finished his [[conscription in Israel]], Duvdevani lived in India for a year,{{cite web|title=Infected Mushroom biography|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/infected-mushroom-mn0000087910|work=AllMusic|publisher=Rovi Corp|access-date=18 June 2012}} primarily in the Indian state of [[Goa]].{{cite web |url=http://www.novafm.com.au/article_infected-mushroom-powerful-not-poisonous_96087 |title=Infected Mushroom: Powerful not poisonous – NovaFM Features |publisher=Novafm.com.au |access-date=28 July 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005050957/http://www.novafm.com.au/article_infected-mushroom-powerful-not-poisonous_96087 |archive-date=5 October 2011 |df=dmy-all }} Duvdevani later collaborated with a member of Shiva Shidapu on four tracks, but they were never released. == Career == === 1996–2004: First four studio albums === Eisen and Duvdevani first began to play together in 1996.{{Cite web |url=http://psychedelicmagazine.com/interviews/infected-mushroom-interview/ |title=Infected Mushroom interview |website=Psychedelic Magazine |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170408092445/http://psychedelicmagazine.com/interviews/infected-mushroom-interview/ |archive-date=2017-04-08 |access-date=2019-04-06}} A few of their early efforts were released under the name Shidapu & Duvdev. The duo then renamed themselves Infected Mushroom, a name they stole from a local punk band that had been disbanded. The young duo drew inspiration from [[The Prodigy]] and [[Metallica]]. In an interview with Psychedelic Magazine, the duo stated they were naturally attracted to the psytrance genre through its popularity. In 1998 the group began work on their first album, 1999's ''The Gathering'', inspired by Simon Posford, X-Dream and Transwave. This album featured a dark, rhythmic sonic atmosphere exemplified by its popular track, "Psycho", using a sample from the movie [[Batman & Robin (film)|Batman & Robin]].{{cn|date=June 2021}} It was one of the first albums to bring {{Cl|Israeli_psychedelic_trance_musicians|Israeli psytrance}} to mainstream audiences, and contributed to the genre's worldwide popularity.{{cite web|url=http://archive.vcstar.com/entertainment/infected-mushroom-with-a-viewon-trance-israeli-bands-and-whether-palestinians-rock-ep-514573106-352265091.html|title=Infected Mushroom with a view...on trance, Israeli bands and whether Palestinians rock|access-date=10 January 2017}} Their 2000 album, ''Classical Mushroom'', contained "Bust a Move". The album is commonly referred to as one of the group's best efforts, one in which they continued their sonic evolution, and it remains one of the best-known albums in the genre.{{citation needed|date=June 2011}} The duo's 2001 ''B.P. Empire'' is notable for the musical epic "Dancing with Kadafi", which segues numerous styles of music, most notably through middle-eastern style melodies and a classical break which showcases Erez and Amit's piano skills. The name "Dancing with Kadafi" may be a reference to Erez's cat, who was named Kadafi. ''Converting Vegetarians'' (2003), was a two-disc set. The 'Trance Side' disc contained trance-like dancefloor material comparable to their earlier work, while the disc entitled 'The Other Side' contained genre-bending experimental music. 'The Other Side' included Duvdev's vocal debut on the title track, the down-tempo "Elation Station", and the electro-pop tracks "Blink" and "Illuminaughty". === 2004–2007: ''IM the Supervisor'' and increasing popularity === The 2004 release of ''IM The Supervisor'', continued to mix [[psytrance]] with other musical genres and became Infected Mushroom's best-selling album to date. It was psychedelic in a way that dance music rarely had been prior to its release. Certain parts of IM The Supervisor, most notably the [[gamelan]]-like noises, cut-up samples, and the old-school sequencer throb of "Bombat," were lauded as innovative at the time.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}} {{cn span|date=June 2021|text=Guitarists Thomas Cunningham and Erez Netz joined the group in 2004, the same year as the band relocated from their Haifa base to a studio in [[Los Angeles, California]]. Brazilian percussionist Rogério Jardim was recruited later on, in 2007.}} Infected Mushroom rose to #9 in the influential DJmag Top 100 DJs poll{{cite web|title=DJmag.com: Top 100 DJs 2007|publisher=DJmag.com|url=http://www.djmag.com/index.php?op=top100dj&top100dj_op=results&year=2007|access-date=25 May 2008}} and were the highest placed psytrance DJs in the category's 2007 debut appearance, a reflection of the role the group had played in the genre's increased worldwide popularity. === 2007–2012: ''Vicious Delicious'' and ''Legend of the Black Shawarma'' === [[File:Infected Mushroom in Russia.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Infected Mushroom in Russia (2011)]] ''Vicious Delicious'', considered by some as their most diverse musical effort up until that point, was released in 2007. The album includes "Becoming Insane"—a Spanish-guitar-led track containing Spanish lyrics—a collaboration with Gil Cerezo of the Mexican band [[Kinky (band)|Kinky]], and the hip hop-influenced "Artillery" featuring rappers [[Swollen Members]]. The overall album features more guest vocalists than previous albums, as well as live guitars and drums.{{Cite web|title=Infected Mushroom Vicious Delicious|url=http://exclaim.ca/music/article/infected_mushroom-vicious_delicious|access-date=2020-10-23|website=exclaim.ca|language=en}} ''[[Legend of the Black Shawarma]]''{{cite web|title=Infected Mushroom / Bio|url=http://www.reverbnation.com/artist/bio/artist_144936|work=ReverbNation|publisher=ReverbNation|access-date=18 June 2012}} was released in 2009. It includes a remix of [[The Doors]] song "[[Riders on the Storm]]",Shim, Dave. [{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r1572474|pure_url=yes}} Legend of the Black Shawarma review] Retrieved on October 13, 2009. and continues the stylistic variety and use of guest vocalists. The album title refers to an Australian who wanted to go to sea in a shark-proof cage and was told that he would seem like "black [[shawarma]]", a West Asian delicacy, to the sharks.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} The success of ''Legend of the Black Shawarma'' led to a three-year tour.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} === 2012–2015: ''Army of Mushrooms'' and ''Friends on Mushrooms'' === The band's album, ''[[Army of Mushrooms]]'', was released on 8 May 2012 on the [[Dim Mak Records]] label. It features tracks influenced by the psychedelic trance, [[dubstep]], [[house music|house]] and [[drum and bass]] genres, such as the up-tempo, breakbeat track "The Rat". The album includes a cover of "The Pretender" by the [[Foo Fighters]], the progressive heavy-hitter "Drum n' Bassa" and "Nation of Wusses"—released as a single on 3 April 2012—and "U R So Fucked",{{cite web|title=Infected Mushroom Army of Mushrooms |url=http://www.realdetroitweekly.com/detroit/infected-mushroom/Content?oid=1545739 |work=Ear Candy, Real Detroit Weekly |publisher=Real Detroit Weekly, LLC |access-date=18 June 2012 |author=Patrick Dunn |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626144928/http://www.realdetroitweekly.com/detroit/infected-mushroom/Content?oid=1545739 |archive-date=26 June 2015 }} released as a single/video on 14 February 2012.{{cite web|title=Click here to find out more! Album Review: Infected Mushroom – Army of Mushrooms|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2012/05/album-review-infected-mushroom-army-of-mushrooms/|work=Consequence of Sound|publisher=Consequence of Sound|access-date=18 June 2012|author=Jake Cohen|date=10 May 2012}} A large-scale [[North America]]n tour was launched on 12 May 2012, called "The Unveiling", and featured revamped stage production and novel audio/visual live aspects. The new live production featured Erez and Duvdev within two specially designed hollow spheres placed on stage, among other [[high tech]] additions to the band's live set-up and multimedia backdrop.Ifeanyi, KC (14 May 2012) [http://www.fastcocreate.com/1680780/a-fantastic-voyage-behind-infected-mushroom-s-psychedelic-new-show "A Fantastic Voyage: Behind Infected Mushroom's Psychedelic New Show"] – 'FastCocreate' January 2013 saw the duo embark on their ''FungusAmongUS'' tour across North America, with special guests [[The M Machine]]. The "FungusAmongUS" tour was designed by Vita Motus and V Squared Labs, the creators of Amon Tobin's ISAM production and Skrillex's live Cell production.{{cite web|title=Infected Mushroom To Release 'Friends On Mushrooms, Vol. 2' On July 16, 2013|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/press/infected-mushroom-to-release-friends-on-mushrooms-vol-2-on-july-16-2013|work=Contact Music|publisher=Contactmusic.com Ltd|access-date=26 April 2014|year=2012}} The duo released a collaborative [[extended play|EP]] named ''Friends'' on ''Mushrooms Vol. 1'' in January 2013, again under Dim Mak Records. The EP consists of tracks featuring [[Astrix]] and [[Hatikva 6]]. In July 2013, the duo released ''Friends on Mushrooms Vol. 2'', also under Dim Mak Records, which consisted of collaborations with Pegboard Nerds, Savant and Kelsy Karter. In mid-2013, Infected Mushroom embarked on a tour in support of the ''Vol. 2'' release that featured the duo "set against an incredible three dimensional landscape that brings INFECTED MUSHROOM's visual and sonic journey to life." In August 2013, due to the leaked song "Aura", Infected Mushroom was revealed as a production team on [[Lady Gaga]]'s third studio album ''[[Artpop]]''.{{cite web|title=ARTPOP songwriting credit revealed|url=http://gagadaily.com/news/artpop-credits//|access-date=18 June 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826193317/http://gagadaily.com/news/artpop-credits/#|archive-date=26 August 2014|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}} ''Friends on Mushrooms Vol. 3'' was released on 17 June 2014 and includes a collaboration with [[Savant (musician)|Savant]].{{cite web |url=http://stoneyroads.com/2014/06/friends-on-mushrooms-vol-3-giveaway |title=WIN: Infected Mushroom Merch + New EP 'Friends on Mushrooms Vol.3' |author=Stoney Roads |date=14 June 2014 |access-date=31 January 2015 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.beatport.com/release/friends-on-mushrooms-vol-3/1321420 |title=Friends On Mushrooms, Vol. 3 [Dim Mak Records] |publisher=[[Beatport]] |access-date=31 January 2015 }} On 1 April 2014, Duvdevani said that Infected Mushroom will be releasing a new album at the end of the year. It was later revealed that Infected Mushroom will in fact be releasing a compilation of the tracks from the Friends On Mushrooms extended plays, bundled together with two new tracks, "Kafkaf" and "Kazabubu". This was released on 6 January 2015.{{cite web|title=Friends On Mushrooms (Deluxe Edition) on Amazon.com|website=Amazon|url=https://www.amazon.com/Friends-Mushrooms-Deluxe-Infected-Mushroom/dp/B00QLD43JE/}} === 2015–2018: ''Converting Vegetarians II'', ''Return to the Sauce'', and ''Monstercat'' === {{Listen|filename=Infected Mushroom Animatronica cut.ogg|title=Animatronica (Converting Vegetarians II)|description=Audio clip of "Animatronica" by Infected Mushroom from the album ''[[Converting Vegetarians II]]''}} Following their Animatronica tour, the band officially announced that their new album will be a follow up to their widely acclaimed Converting Vegetarians album of 2003, sporting the same name. Additionally, it has been announced that the vocals of [[Sasha Grey]] will be featured in the track Fields of Grey. The album was released on 11 September 2015.[https://soundcloud.com/dimmakrecords/infected-mushroom-fields-of-grey-feat-sasha-grey Infected Mushroom – Fields Of Grey (feat. Sasha Grey)] on [[SoundCloud]] On 27 January 2017, the band released their eleventh studio album, ''[[Return to the Sauce]]'', which features their signature psy-trance sound.{{Cite web |url=https://dancingastronaut.com/2017/01/infected-mushroom-return-to-the-sauce-album-review/ |title=Infected Mushroom return to psytrance in 'Return to the Sauce' |date=2017-01-31 |website=Dancing Astronaut |language=en-US |access-date=2019-05-25}} This is in stark contrast to ''[[Converting Vegetarians II]]'', which is more ambient and down-tempo in style. The release of ''Return to the Sauce'' was preceded by two singles, "Liquid Smoke" and "Nutmeg". On 24 November 2017, the band released their single ''Spitfire'' on the Canadian independent record label [[Monstercat]].{{Cite web |url=https://www.youredm.com/2017/11/25/infected-mushroom-spitfire/ |title=Listen to Infected Mushroom's Monstercat Debut, "Spitfire" |last=Fleury |first=Landon |date=2017-11-25 |website=Your EDM |language=en-US |access-date=2019-05-25}} === 2018–present: ''IM21 Pt.1'', and ''Head of NASA and the 2 Amish Boys'' === On 9 March 2018, the band released ''IM21, Pt.1'' under the label Hommega.{{Cite web|url=https://www.beatport.com/release/im21-pt-1/2217596|title=IM21, Pt. 1 from HOMmega Productions on Beatport|website=www.beatport.com|access-date=20 September 2018}} It is composed of remixes of "Bust a Move", "Suliman", "Saeed", "Yamakas in space", and an acoustic live remix of "i-Wish". These were remixed by groups such as Bliss, No Comment, [[Paranormal Attack]] and Modulation. The acoustic remix of "i-Wish" was done by the band itself.{{citation needed|date=September 2018}} On 30 October 2018, the band announced a new full-length album titled ''[[Head of NASA and the 2 Amish Boys]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/infected/status/1057376638403469312|website=www.twitter.com|title=Infected Mushroom on Twitter...|access-date=30 October 2018}} The album was released through [[Monstercat]] on 12 December that same year. There are seven tracks on the album which are mainly electronic with psytrance influences and include one hip-hop collaboration song with Israeli artist Tuna and Israeli girl band A-WA in Hebrew, Arabic and English – ''Lost in Space''.{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/8489960/infected-mushroom-head-of-nasa-album-breakdown |title=Infected Mushroom Break Down 'Head Of NASA and the 2 Amish Boys' Album: Exclusive |magazine=Billboard |access-date=2018-12-13}} In 2020, the group released their 12th album ''[[:he:More than Just a Name|More Than Just a Name]]''.{{Cite web|date=2020-05-17|title=More Than Just A Name – Infected Mushroom {{!}} Album Review|url=https://www.thereviewgeek.com/morethanjustaname-infectedmushroom-albumreview/|access-date=2020-10-23|website=The Review Geek|language=en-GB}} It features collaborations with [[Astrix]] and Bliss. The track ''Infected Megamix'' features a montage of past popular Infected Mushroom songs. On July 7, 2022, Infected Mushroom released the single "A Cookie from Space", announced to be the first single from their 25-year anniversary album, ''IM25''.{{Cite web |url=https://themusicessentials.com/music/infected-mushroom-a-cookie-from-space/ |title=Legendary Psytrance Duo Infected Mushroom Announce Highly-Anticipated 25-Year Anniversary Album 'IM25' With First Single "A Cookie From Space" |website=T.H.E Music Essentials |date=7 July 2022 | first=Bhanawat| last=Akshay| access-date=8 July 2022}} == Touring == On average, the band completes 120 live annual performances, including the [[Ultra Music Festival]] in [[Miami]], US; the Virgin Festival in Baltimore, US; [[Mexico]]'s OMIX; California, US' [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival]]; [[Brazil]]'s Ipanema Beach; [[Melbourne]], Australia's Metro Club; and the 2009, 2011, 2014, 2016, and 2022 [[Burning Man|Burning Man Festival]]s in Black Rock City, Nevada, US.{{cite web|url=https://www.residentadvisor.net/dj/infectedmushroom/biography|title=RA: Infected Mushroom|first=Resident|last=Advisor|access-date=10 January 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.electronic-festivals.com/event/burning-man|title=Burning Man 27/08/2017 ★ Lineup ★ News ★ Videos ★ Information - ELECTRONIC-FESTIVALS.COM|access-date=10 January 2017}} Infected Mushroom have been twice ranked amongst the world's "10 Best DJ's" by readers of U.K.'s ''[[DJ Magazine]]''. == Discography == {{Main|Infected Mushroom discography}} * ''The Gathering'' (1999) * ''Classical Mushroom'' (2000) * ''B.P. Empire'' (2001) * ''Converting Vegetarians'' (2003) * ''IM the Supervisor'' (2004) * ''Vicious Delicious'' (2007) * ''[[Legend of the Black Shawarma]]'' (2009) * ''[[Army of Mushrooms]]'' (2012) * ''[[Converting Vegetarians II]]'' (2015) * ''[[Return to the Sauce]]'' (2017) * ''[[Head of NASA and the 2 Amish Boys]]'' (2018) * ''More than Just a Name'' (2020) * ''IM25'' (2022) == References == {{Reflist|2}} == External links == {{Commons category|Infected Mushroom}} * [http://www.infected-mushroom.com Official website] {{Infected Mushroom}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Electronic music duos]] [[Category:Goa trance musicians]] [[Category:Israeli electronic musicians]] [[Category:Israeli electronic music groups]] [[Category:Israeli psychedelic trance musicians]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 1996]] [[Category:Musical groups from Haifa]] [[Category:Monstercat artists]] [[Category:Dim Mak Records artists]] [[Category:Psychedelic trance musical groups]] [[Category:Tracker musicians]] [[Category:Israeli musical duos]]
